p.span:
Families,
I hope this letter finds you well. I want to thank all of you that had a chance to fill out the parent survey that was sent out this past Monday. I appreciate the feedback and will use it with our staff as we move forward with the school year. The amount of pride that I have for not only the staff, but for you as parents continues to grow as we all navigate our way through distant learning.
Iâd like to point out a few things that you should all be aware of. Teachers for the extracurricular classes we offer at Sharon Elementary (PE, Art, World Languages, Music, Library, Guidance) have developed a âHubâ that students can access online. You can find the link on the school website. Each teacher will be adding new content to their page weekly. If you have not seen this yet, please reach out to either myself or your childâs teacher to gain access.
As mentioned in my previous letter, we are now in Phase 2 of distance-learning called Continuity of Learningâ. The teachers have been extremely busy over the last few weeks identifying proficiencies that students will be focused towards. Teachers will work with students to gain skills in the areas of math and literacy, as well as suggesting activities in the sciences. How this looks will depend on a number of factors including internet accessibility and the level of support that is needed.
School meals will continue through our April break. If you are accessing those meals, please continue to do so. If there are times when you do not need the meal, please email our food service director, Linann Perry at lperry@wrvsu.org. If you have not been accessing the meals but would like to start, again, email Mrs. Perry.
We have been working hard to make sure all students have devices in order to access online content. Iâve been working with the SU to find grants that may support folks who do not have internet access. If your child is in need of a device (Chromebook or Ipad), please let me, or your childâs teacher know.
I have had the opportunity to attend every class for meetings. Itâs so nice to see the childrenâs faces and to hear their thoughts. In fact, attending these meetings is the best part of my workday. Iâm impressed with everyone involved, teachers, support staff and students. Thank you for helping your child attend and stay connected to their classroom.
I hope everyone has a great vacation week. I know it is not what it may typically be, but I know everyone will make the best of it. Our learning will start up again on Monday, April 27th. Until then, be well, keep healthy and as always, reach out if you need anything.
Sincerely,
Keenan Haley
Principal
Sharon Elementary

div.h2: (04/10/2020 â 5 pm ) Important letter to families
div.p: Families,
Â Â Â I hope all of you are doing ok during this tough time. I have a few things that I want to make you aware of.Â Â

Â Â Â Starting Monday, April 13th, we are required to take student attendance. You will receive an email daily that has a google document embedded in it. The only thing that you will need to do is to fill in your childâs or multiple childrenâs names and then hit submit. By doing this your child will be counted as present for that day of school. I know this is just another thing to do, but it is important for counting our school days as official.Â

Â Â Â In yesterdayâs communication considering minimum daily on task work times, I want to make it clear that these suggestions are minimum times. The hope is that families will develop learning times in their day to the greatest extent possible. Over time, the hope is that we can enhance the amount of time spent on school throughout a students day. Again, how this looks in each family is based on each familiesâ circumstances. If you would like to connect with your childâs teacher to discuss a possible schedule for student learning for the day, please reach out to them.Â

Â Â Â We are still going to honor our April break time period. Teachers will not assign work for the week of April 20th. My hope is that we can all take that time to relax and to recharge for the remainder of the school year.Â

Â Â Â We will be continuing our lunch service during the April break. The same schedule will be in place. Lunches will be provided Monday, Wednesday and Friday from 11:00 am until 1:00 pm. If you have not accessed this service and would like to, please email me at khaley@sharonelementary.org.Â
Â Â Â I will be sending a parent survey asking for feedback about distance learning. Please take a moment to fill this out as it will give us valuable information in our planning as we move forward.Â

Â Â Â I canât express how grateful I am to have such an amazing staff. The teachers have been doing a heroic job of creating a whole new learning environment. They are overwhelmed, but they are committed to staying connected to their students.Â

Â Â Â Please reach out to me with any questions, concerns, or comments that you have. I am truly lucky to be able to be a part of this community. Sharonâs community continues to impress me with their resilience in the face of difficult times.Â
Thank you and be well,Â

Keenan Haley
Principal
Sharon ElementaryÂ
div.h2: Press Release from the Superintendentâs Office
div.p: Following final contract negotiations and fulfilling Vermont Agency of Education requirements, Jamie Kinnarney, will become the new superintendent, responsible for overseeing education operations for six school districts and the SU office in the White River Valley Supervisory Union (WRVSU). The WRVSU Board hired Kinnarney to replace the current superintendent, Bruce Labs. Kinnarney was selected as a finalist from a field of 13 candidates, who reside from within and outside Vermont. Kinnarney, was raised and educated in South Royalton and possesses undergrad and graduate degrees from three colleges in Vermont. He formerly taught in South Royalton, Bristol, and Randolph Schools. Kinnarney has been an adjunct professor at Norwich University and currently is a highly respected education consultant, providing leadership training for school administrators throughout Vermont. Kinnarney is currently the principal for the Williamstown Schools and has served in that role for the past seven years. The new superintendent will begin leadership duties on July 1, 2020.
